title: The pulley failed in a few days
body: It feels like it's a big brand and the quality should be ok. I didn't expect the scroll wheel of the mouse to be broken. It has only been used for a few days, and now it can't slide down. disappointment.

title: Good
body: Excelent

title: Scroll wheel had a stroke after 6 months
body: The scroll wheel literally scrolls whatever directing it wants now. Only purchased this 6 months ago. If you don't use the scroll wheel much it's good but not great other than that...

title: it works!
body: came in perfectly and works well

title: Wheel randomly scrolls in opposite direction
body: I bought this mouse 2 months ago and the wheel is already misbehaving.I attempted to contact Razer support to repair/replace the mouse, but I received an auto response that the product is no longer under Razer limited warranty, and I cannot go beyond this step to speak with a customer service rep. I'm guessing the serial number is old.. Is Amazon distributing outdated mice..?This is the 2nd Deathadder Essential with wheel issues. Will not purchase this again.Disappointed.

title: cat approves
body: i’ve had it for 3 months and i have had any problems, and the led it still as bright! :>

title: Bad scroll wheel
body: all is good, except for the mouse wheel. Scroll gets really jumpy starting 2 months in. It works if you blow some canned duster, and I'm trying to see if contact cleaner can help the situation.

title: My favorite mouse
body: This is my favorite mouse of all time. I have 3 as backups in case Razer every changes it. I have small hands and can't use an MMORPG mouse (big sad) so it's helpful to have the couple extra buttons on the side.

title: Solid for the price
body: I don't use this for gaming, as I'm not a gamer. I only use it for office work. Compared to any other mouse I've tried in the price range, this is by far the best. It's comfortable in the hand, it's light, and moves with ease, and the buttons respond well. Not really much more to ask for in a mouse if it's for office use unless you want to go super high-end4.

title: perfect mouse for gaming
body: i’m so sad that you can’t change the color of the rgb in the mouse! ( i have other razor items ) but it’s fine i made my setup match anyways :)

title: Squeaky Wheel
body: Seems like a good mouse, but the wheel squeaks like nails on a chalkboard, which leaves me with the options of taking it apart and fixing the wheel, shooting WD-40 inside, or returning it, all of which are a pain because I just want a simple mouse that works. Is there QA to make sure the wheels are greased before sending these out?

title: Not sure if defective or just loud
body: Got this to replace a older $12 non name brand mouse had for a couple years that was starting to get old and had several razor mice over the years but honestly wasn't sure what to expect given price point on this one. Overall feel and control of the mouse is fine basically what youd expect for a gaming mouse. The fatal flaw though is the mouse wheel, it squeaks extremely loudly with any movement and its like nails on a caulk board. Seems like proper clearance wasnt given between the wheel and the track it sits in but ive tried to ignore it for almost a week hoping it would break it and wear down or loosen up but sadly it has not and im honestly about to switch back to my old mouse and just order another like it.

title: Great beginners mouse
body: Great beginners mouse for people newer to PC gaming. It’s not too small or too big.

title: Fix your scroll wheels
body: These things last a month before the scroll wheel starts acting out of wack. Scrolling down will sometimes scroll up, about 45% of the time. Gone through 2 already in two months.

title: garbage sensor
body: cheaper out on sensor

title: Better than more $$$ options
body: It's perfect for me. It's a bigger mouse and I love that. I have multiple more expensive Razer gaming mice and prefer this one for prolonged use. Amazing price for what you get. It is only the green illumination, so it's not RGB if that bothers you!

title: First usage of 'better' mouse
body: I wanted to title this "First usage of a high-end mouse", but at this price, it isn't really high-end, but it is a step up from the cheaper mice, and I wanted to see what it was like.I am impressed (mostly).It is a heavier mouse, but that makes it feel more solid, and I like that a lot. I also really, really noticed the very smooth gliding of the mouse, and like this a lot.I don't do head-to-head gaming; most of my games are solo playing. I don't really see much of a difference with this mouse over the old mice.I'm really used to 3-button mouse, so I really don't know what to use the two extra mouse buttons for (they are on the left side of the mouse, and they won't be accidentally clicked as long as the grip stays in the lower area. I looked up some suggestions, but I was a bit disappointed that some key combinations don't work (I was hoping to map ctrl+windows+left to one button and ctrl+windows+right to the other, but it doesn't seem to realize when I press the windows button).That brings us to the software.. you have to install it to adjust the lights or assign the buttons. The EULA basically says that they collect data on usage. I did want the lights to turn off after a time, and I like the "breathing" light... so, for now, I'm running it (the effects don't stick when you don't run the program). I don't trust the software that comes with the mouse. There may be some other way to control it.Aside from the software, I'm impressed by my foray into fancier mice.

title: Scroll Wheel Jumps
body: After only a few months the scroll wheel jumps horribly. Razor support was very unhelpful. After submitting my video evidence my claim was accepted to receive a replacement, then the replacement support sent me a passive aggressive message telling me they'll make a one time exception to replace the mouse after demanding further proof of it not working correctly. Honestly, not worth the hassle, I gave up trying to work with them for a replacement. This is probably a good mouse if you don't need to use the scroll wheel often.

title: Scroll wheel started malfunctioning after a few months of normal use
body: I knew razer was cheap garbage but this really cemented it for me. I've had 5 dollar mice from no-name brands last longer

title: Very Very nice mouse
body: This mouse is cheap but feels great! Not super heavy but not to light. I've had this mouse for 7 mouths, and it works amazing, sensor on it is great and you won't have to worry about anything going wrong with it.

title: Good but has issues
body: The mouse initially seems good. The ergonomic fit seems too ergonomic to the point it feels weird. But that is more personal preference. However the page lies about the "rubberized side grips" there is no rubber, it just textured plastic, the same that is on the whole mouse. Overall basic gaming mouse does what is intended but misleading informaction.

title: Scroll wheel issues
body: Bought on OCT 26th 2022 and by FEB 22 2022 the scroll wheel is no longer working properly. Was having issues a few weeks before and cleaning it and updating the software did nothing. Razer apparently no longer supports or will warranty it.. Guess they can't stand by a product for 4 months of light use.

title: Excellent budget mouse
body: Great mouse with a nice large size.

title: Good
body: Had this mouse for 3 years now and the scroll wheel and right click sometimes double click or don't register at all. Definitely buying another one to replace it.

title: Enjoyable!
body: This mouse is price effective and very nice. Its the kind that fits your whole hand so it just sits there without cramping up

title: Scroll Broken
body: I’ve had this thing a couple of months and when I try to scroll quickly it will go the other direction at intervals.

title: very good
body: very good

title: Not bad
body: Not bad but feels really cheap

title: Scroll wheel
body: Scroll wheel started not working after 3 months

title: Scroll wheel keeps scrolling the opposite direction after only 8 months
body: After only 8 months, this mouse has already suffered problems with the scroll wheel scrolling the opposite direction despite me barely using the scroll wheel.Don't listen to the reviews that say it has "good quality", this is very cheap and designed to make you keep buying as many replacements as possible.

title: Wheel is trash
body: after couple of months wheel is not working properly , also surface is a dust magnit. i think it is not a good option to buy

title: Died after return date
body: I bought this to replace my old one not only does it feel cheaper made from cord to everything. but after 3 months just 2 weeks after the return date the laser on the mouse died the mouse point acts wacky and i cant use the mouse at all

title: An oldie but a goodie
body: Always like this mouse.Works great!

title: Center wheel broke after 6 months
body: Great mouse but the center wheel broke after only owning it 6 months. I expect a mouse to last longer than that.

title: El cable es muy rígido y el maus también
body: No me gustó tener esa sensación de rigidez en el cable, juego con mi laptop y es muy difícil mover maus.

title: scroll wheel broken, bad design
body: broken, asked for replacement, still broken. just poor design

title: It okay
body: Feels weird holding it. Doesn’t contour to my hand. But I will deal with it.

title: Scroll Wheel immediately broke
body: Scroll wheel broke within a few weeks of use

title: It is a mid mouse
body: I like this mouse but it is all plastic and has only two programmable buttons. But It is a good product for what I paid for. I would not recommend this if it is for anything other than gaming though. The mouse sensitivity is way too high for other uses. I am still happy with the purchase I made.

title: Broke
body: After using for about a week, it broke. I do not know why. It would not connect to my laptop so I had to throw it out.

title: Don’t listen to the other reviews!
body: Video Player is loading.

title: As advertised
body: Mouse working like a mouse should :-)

title: Almost perfect, scroll wheel broke 5 months in
body: Buttons on the side very large and comfortable to press while gaming, ergonomic design, neon green color kind of ugly, BREAKS AFTER 5 MONTHS

title: Great
body: Like a charm!

title: it works and easy to setup
body: it works and easy to setup

title: Scroll wheel broken in ~3 months
body: I really wish I could recommend this mouse. It was great when I got it: lightweight, matched my setup well, and seemed well constructed. However, I bought this in October 2022 and by January 2023, the scroll wheel has already been broken. I have to scroll down VERY slowly and gently, or else scrolling down will actually result in scrolling up.I do play some games, but I wouldn't describe myself as a heavy gamer who uses their scroll wheel harshly or often. I usually just use it while browsing the internet. Don't gamble on this item and spend your money elsewhere.

title: Don’t buy
body: My mouse came in the mail and didn’t work and I wasn’t refunded nor was I given a replacement do not buy

title: good quality for the price <3
body: would definitely recommend!

title: Okay, but...
body: I liked this mouse at first: it felt great, looked great, etc. However, after about 6 months or so the mouse buttons only work about 80% of the time. As you can imagine, this is really annoying when playing a FPS game when you can't ADS or fire your weapon! I have not had any issues with the scroll wheel as others have mentioned.

title: Why are people giving this 5 stars if the middle scroll wheel doesn't work?
body: This mouse is unusable as its middle scroll wheel doesn't work properly. It will randomly scroll upward when you want to go down. I took it apart and there's no debris causing this.

title: Doesn’t work
body: Don’t work

title: problem after 1 month
body: I recently gave this as a birthday gift to my brother and fast forward a few weeks later I spoke to him, he told me he replaced this mouse already because it was having a problem when scrolling. So I went to check on it and saw that when he was scrolling down, sometimes it jitters/twitch (I don't know the scientific term for it) where it looks like is spasming between scrolling up and down, before it continue scrolling down again.I always thought Razer was a well known brand, I guess that was not my experience. I guess you get what you pay for.

title: Easy to set up PnP all the way
body: I always bought a cheap mouse and never spent more than 20 USD when I see this mouse for around 20 USD I was like let's buy and see what the fuse is all about . Well, Now I Know this is a great mouse my gameplay has gotten better This is a quality Mouse and is worth the money for a budget gamer.

title: Mouse Wheel jumpy; can't open to clean
body: Bought from a gamestop. It looks like the back screw is underneath the plastic--can't be opened. Mouse wheel became 'jumpy' after about a month or so of use.

title: Still works!
body: I think anyone who has ever purchased Razer products in the past can understand that lasting more than 6 months without issues is great for razer. So here I am, 5 months later and nothing to report so far. The only reason I went back to Deathadder is because it was always my favorite mouse but it kept dying every 6 months back when it was 150 dollars. So now that's its so much cheaper, I think it's worth replacing if it does break. Love deathadder. Perfect for the FPS life.

title: Worked great, but have wheel issue after 3 months
body: The mouse worked great in the beginning (hence the 2 stars, otherwise 1) but now the wheel jumps uncontrollably after just 3 months of moderate use. Doesn't hold up well at all.

title: Muy bueno
body: De muy buena calidad, muy estable y preciso. Lo mejor es el tamaño, adecuado para un hombre adulto.

title: Didnt last 2 months
body: In less than 2 months of daily use,the scroll wheel doesn't function properly.Every time I go to scroll down, the webpage would scroll up.....Do yourself a favor and spend extra $10-20 on a better mouse that will last longer.Very disappointed.First and Last time I purchase a Razor mouse.

title: Love it
body: For someone who's a big gamer, this is one of my favorite brands to buy from. I love how their mouses and keyboards are especially. For the price, it's really good quality. Very light and easy to hold. I wish the cable wasn't so annoying but it's just something that needs fixing on my end.Definitely a great buy for the price.

title: My gamer husband really likes this mouse
body: My husband needed something simple and light, and this fits the bill.

title: Will not buy again!
body: This is the second Razer product I have bought and will be the last. Several months ago I bought a Head phones and they just lost all volume after 1 month turned it to maximum could barley hear anything. This mouse is super small for my adult hand, and now 2 months in the wheel doesn't work right I scroll down it bounced down and up. Very disappointed with this mouse. I typically buy this price point and they ALL do break but usually after 1-2 years. I have not had any luck with Razer at all.

title: Scroll wheel broke after 2.5 months
body: Scrolling up scrolls down.Scrolling down scrolls up.Useless for scrolling means useless for gaming.Putting in the serial number + issue + following their troubleshooting steps greets me with a "Your product is no longer covered by Razer's Limited Warranty"I dug a Microsoft Wheel Mouse Optical out of a box of junk from the garage and the thing still scrolls perfectly, I probably used that mouse for 10 years. This is ridiculous after less than 3 months, I am not a pro-gamer.

title: Scroll wheel
body: Scroll wheel went bad really fast.

title: Good Mouse, Gets the Job Done
body: I'm currently away from home due to my job, and i'll be away from home often because of it. So i needed a A mouse, and this one was the perfect fit.

title: stops working after 2 days
body: stopped working for me after 2-3 days

title: Uncomfortable and cheep plastic feeling
body: Feels cheep. Uncomfortable to use. Weird shape. To top it off, synapse software doesn't recognize it and support couldn't get it to work either. Skip Razer and get something else.

title: Good
body: Good

title: perfect
body: Very cheap, but very easy to use

title: Premium quality
body: 1. Very good gamming mouse for the price2. Premium quality3. Works good for gaming4. Recommend this mouse for gammers that are on budgets

title: Too wide for my hand
body: I have bigger than average hands but this mouse was uncomfortably wide. The mouse wheel is so wide that I triggered it when using the L R buttons, which can be fatal when gaming. I sent it back.

title: Great, but scroll wheel issues
body: Great until the scroll wheel starts messing up and requires disassemble and cleaning

title: Great for my son's desk
body: He loves this mouse

title: DO NOT BUY!
body: A few months in scrolling became unusable. It would jump around and often go the opposite direction intended. Looking online, this is a common problem with this mouse. Quality control must be terrible or Razer just doesn't care but I know for sure I'll be avoiding Razer mice going forward.

title: Scroll wheel jumping after less than a year
body: While scrolling, the view jumps up and down. The scroll wheel sensor is clearly failing. Unfortunate... I really like this mouse otherwise.

title: Maybe bad luck?
body: I bought one of these mice almost a year ago and I ran into a problem where the scroll wheel would sometimes "jump" in the opposite direction one space every so often. I bought it again because I like the mouse despite the issue. Not even a month into having this mouse, I'm beginning to see signs of the same problem.And yes, I've tried every software fix I could to see if it might be a software issue, but nothing has fixed it so I can only blame the mouse at this point. The first razer product I've had issues with.

title: Mac buyers beware- Control software not compatible with MacOS...
body: It's a fine mouse-works right out of the box on my MacBook Pro. However, the in-house mouse control software (the bells & whistles part) is not available for the Mac, and that little tidbit was not apparent on Amazon or Razer's website. Another missing piece is the interface- I have a Thunderbolt Mac. Had to buy an adapter. That would have been nice to know. Should have stuck with a known- Logitech's mouse software is available for MacOS. Alas...

title: After a Few Months, the Scroll Wheel Causes the Screen to Jump
body: I've had this mouse for just over a year, and have had to disassemble it twice to clean the scroll wheel area. It's not a difficult job, but I have had decent mice of other brands last much longer before any maintenance was required. While cleaning, I found dust and dirt inside the mouse, so it might behoove Razer to seal their products a bit better.

title: Good gaming mouse!
body: It is not too heavy or bug to hold, and it is smooth when using it! Definitely worth for buying!

title: right button stopped working
body: After 3 mouths right button stopped working

title: Great mouse but short lifespan?
body: This mouse is a beautiful piece but it has weird scrolling issues, after barely a month? Worth every penny though.

title: good
body: good

title: Scroll button broke, and then kind of fixed itself. Don't Recommend
body: The mouse is responsive enough but you have to sign into an account if you want to use some features of it. After about 3 months the scroll button started to feel different and then it malfunctioned. It began working again but not as well as before and now it feels awkward to scroll. I can not recommend this mouse.

title: Mouse wheel desgin is severely flawed
body: I do not recommend. Only my 4th month using this mouse on my desktop PC, and the scroll wheel is malfunctioning. Scrolling down or up through pages is annoying because it jumps the opposite direction half the time. This is a common issue with this mouse as I have found dozens of forum posts explaining the same malfunction. The only solution to this is to completely take apart the mouse. All buyers be ware, because I have never had this issue, even on cheap mouses.

title: Mouse Wheel Breaks
body: Have purchased 2, both times the mouse wheel broke and stopped functioning properly.

title: It's a mouse...
body: I got this for my office to replace my death adder elite that wasn't registering clicks anymore. Since it's for my office I'm not nit picking too hard, but I'm glad it was a cheap mouse because it's not as responsive in movements or clicks as the higher tier mice. If you're looking for a gaming mouse, spend the extra money. Also bumping down an extra star for the razer logo not lighting up like it's supposed to.

title: csgo
body: using for csgo, im a big guy with big hands, love the mouse so far.

title: Extremely good
body: Extremely nice mouse, perfect for the price.

title: Love it !!
body: Good and genuine product !! No issues and delivery was made in time !! Thank you so much Amazon !!

title: Amazing !!
body: Thank you so much, really good product for gaming. Shipping was fast and delivery was done in time
